intro: Salmasia praecox, commonly known as the early salmasia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Salmasia praecox typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
